channel.title: math.AT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: New infinite families in the stable homotopy groups of spheres
item.description: arXiv:2404.10062v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We identify seven new $192$-periodic infinite families of elements in the $2$-primary stable homotopy groups of spheres, whose images are nontrivial in the $\mathrm{K}(2)$- as well as the $\mathrm{T}(2)$-local stable stems. We also obtain new information about $2$-torsion and $2$-divisibility of some of the known $192$-periodic infinite families in the stable stems.
item.dc:creator: Prasit Bhattacharya, Irina Bobkova, J. D. Quigley

item.title: Homology operations for gravity algebras
item.description: arXiv:2404.10639v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $\mathcal{M}_{0,n+1}$ be the moduli space of genus zero Riemann surfaces with $n+1$ marked points. In this paper we compute $H_*^{\Sigma_n}(\mathcal{M}_{0,n+1};\mathbb{F}_p)$ and $H_*^{\Sigma_n}(\mathcal{M}_{0,n+1};\mathbb{F}_p(\pm 1))$ for any $n\in\mathbb{N}$ and any prime $p$, where $\mathbb{F}_p(\pm 1)$ denotes the sign representation of the symmetric group $\Sigma_n$. The interest in these homology groups is twofold: on the one hand classes in these equivariant homology groups parametrize homology operations for gravity algebras. On the other hand the homotopy quotient $(\mathcal{M}_{0,n+1})_{\Sigma_n}$ is a model for the classifying space for $B_n/Z(B_n)$, the quotient of the braid group $B_n$ by its center.
item.dc:creator: Tommaso Rossi

item.title: The Topological Cartier--Raynaud Ring
item.description: arXiv:2404.10724v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that the $\infty$-category of $p$-typical topological Cartier modules, recently introduced by Antieau--Nikolaus, over some base $A$ is equivalent to the $\infty$-category of modules over a ring spectrum $\mathcal R_A$, which we call the topological Cartier--Raynaud ring. Our main result is an identification of the homotopy groups of $\mathcal R_A$. In particular, for $A=W(k)$, the Witt vectors over $k$, the homotopy groups $\pi_*\mathcal R_{W(k)}$ recover the classical Cartier--Raynaud ring constructed by Illusie--Raynaud. Moreover, along the way we will describe the compact generator of $p$-typical topological Cartier modules and classifies all natural operations on homotopy groups of $p$-typical topological Cartier modules.
item.dc:creator: Konrad Bals

item.title: Strings in metric spaces
item.description: arXiv:2404.10668v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We introduce strings in metric spaces and define string complexes of metric spaces. We describe the class of 2-dimensional topological spaces which arise in this way from finite metric spaces.
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Turaev

item.title: An equivariant BGG correspondence and perfect complexes for extensions by $\mathbb{Z}/2\times \mathbb{Z}/2$
item.description: arXiv:2404.10735v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We provide an equivariant extension of Carlsson's BGG correspondence in characteristic two. As an application we classify perfect cochain complexes of $(\mathbb{Z}/2\times \mathbb{Z}/2)\rtimes Q$-representations with four-dimensional total homology for finite groups $Q$ of odd order. We deduce that cochain complexes of finite, free $A_4$-CW complexes with four-dimensional total homology are rigid: They are determined by the degrees of the nonzero homology groups.
item.dc:creator: Henrik R\"uping, Marc Stephan

item.title: Higher Analogues of Discrete Topological Complexity
item.description: arXiv:2310.01333v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we introduce the n-th discrete topological complexity and study its properties such as its relation with simplicial Lusternik-Schnirelmann category and how the higher dimensions of discrete topological complexity relate with each other. Moreover, we find a lower bound of $n-$discrete topological complexity which is given by the n-th usual topological complexity of the geometric realisation of that complex. Furthermore, we give an example for the strict case of that lower bound.
item.dc:creator: Hilal Alabay, Ayse Borat, Esra Cihangirli, Esma Dirican Erdal

item.title: Abelian gauge-like groups of $L_\infty$-algebras
item.description: arXiv:2311.08512v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Given a finite type degree-wise nilpotent $L_\infty$-algebra, we construct an abelian group that acts on the set of Maurer-Cartan elements of the given $L_\infty$-algebra so that the quotient by this action becomes the moduli space of equivalence classes of Maurer-Cartan elements. Specializing this to degree-wise nilpotent dg Lie algebras, we find that the associated ordinary gauge group of the dg Lie algebra with the Baker-Campbell-Hausdorff multiplication might be substituted by the underlying additive group. This additive group acts on the Maurer-Cartan elements, and the quotient by this action yields the moduli space of gauge-equivalence classes of Maurer-Cartan elements.
item.dc:creator: Bashar Saleh
